description.zh-cn: 唐太宗第四子，母长孙皇后。雅好文学，工于书法，是当时著名的书画鉴赏家。因才华横溢备受唐太宗宠爱，后因涉嫌与太子李承干争位，被降封并迁徙至均州郧乡，最终在此病逝。
description.en: The fourth son of Emperor Taizong of Tang and Empress Zhangsun. He was a literature enthusiast, skilled calligrapher, and a renowned art connoisseur of his time. Deeply favored by Emperor Taizong for his talent, he was later demoted and exiled to Yunxiang in Junzhou for allegedly plotting against Crown Prince Li Chengqian, where he eventually died.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝第二位皇帝，李泰之父。
description.en: The second emperor of the Tang dynasty, father of Li Tai.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗的皇后，李泰的母亲。
description.en: Empress of Emperor Taizong of Tang, mother of Li Tai.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗嫡长子，原皇太子，后因谋反被废。
description.en: The eldest son of Emperor Taizong of Tang and the original crown prince, who was deposed for treason.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗嫡三子，李泰的胞弟。在李承干被废后，被立为皇太子，后继位为唐高宗。
description.en: The third son of Emperor Taizong of Tang and a full brother of Li Tai. He was made crown prince after Li Chengqian's deposition and later succeeded the throne as Emperor Gaozong.

description.zh-cn: 工部尚书阎立德之女，李泰的王妃。
description.en: Daughter of the Minister of Works Yan Lide, and the wife of Li Tai.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝大臣，官至工部尚书，阎婉之父。
description.en: A minister of the Tang dynasty who served as the Minister of Works, father of Yan Wan.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗的同母弟，早夭。李泰曾被过继为其后嗣。
description.en: A full brother of Emperor Taizong who died young. Li Tai was once posthumously adopted as his heir.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝大臣、书法家，官至谏议大夫。他反对立李泰为太子，并为李泰出资修建的《伊阙佛龛碑》书写碑文。
description.en: A minister and calligrapher of the Tang dynasty. He opposed making Li Tai the crown prince and wrote the calligraphy for the 'Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche' sponsored by Li Tai.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝大臣，长孙皇后之兄。在储位之争中支持立晋王李治为太子。
description.en: A minister of the Tang dynasty and brother of Empress Zhangsun. He supported establishing Prince Jin (Li Zhi) as the crown prince during the succession struggle.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗之弟，因谋反被诛。李泰曾以其事恫吓李治。
description.en: Brother of Emperor Taizong, executed for treason. Li Tai used his case to intimidate Li Zhi.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝将领，官至吏部尚书，后与太子李承干共谋政变。
description.en: A general of the Tang dynasty who served as the Minister of Personnel. He later conspired with Crown Prince Li Chengqian to stage a coup.

description.zh-cn: 李泰长子，嗣濮王。
description.en: Eldest son of Li Tai, who inherited the title Prince of Pu.

description.zh-cn: 李泰次子，封新安郡王。
description.en: Second son of Li Tai, enfeoffed as the Prince of Xin'an Commandery.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝大臣，官至中书侍郎，为《伊阙佛龛碑》撰文。
description.en: A minister of the Tang dynasty who served as Vice Director of the Secretariat. He authored the inscription for the 'Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche'.

description.zh-cn: 一部由李泰主编的大型地理著作，对后世地理书籍体裁有重要影响。
description.en: A large-scale geographical work chief-edited by Li Tai, which had a significant influence on the genre of later geographical books.

en: Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche

description.zh-cn: 李泰为纪念其母长孙皇后，在龙门山宾阳洞开凿佛窟后所立的发愿文碑刻。由岑文本撰文，褚遂良书丹。
description.en: A votive stele erected by Li Tai after commissioning the carving of a Buddha niche in the Binyang Cave at Longmen Grottoes in memory of his mother, Empress Zhangsun. The text was composed by Cen Wenben and written in calligraphy by Chu Suiliang.

description.zh-cn: 唐代均州下辖县，为李泰被贬后的居住地及逝世地。
description.en: A county under Junzhou in the Tang dynasty, where Li Tai lived in exile and died.

description.zh-cn: 李泰是唐太宗李世民的第四子。
description.en: Li Tai was the fourth son of Emperor Taizong, Li Shimin.

description.zh-cn: 李泰是长孙皇后的次子。
description.en: Li Tai was the second son of Empress Zhangsun.

description.zh-cn: 长子
description.en: Eldest son

description.zh-cn: 次子
description.en: Second son

description.zh-cn: 李泰与李承干是同父同母的兄弟。
description.en: Li Tai and Li Chengqian were full brothers.

description.zh-cn: 李泰与李治是同父同母的兄弟。
description.en: Li Tai and Li Zhi were full brothers.

description.zh-cn: 李泰是李玄霸的侄子，并在621年被过继给早夭的叔父李玄霸为后嗣，后归宗。
description.en: Li Tai was the nephew of Li Xuanba and was posthumously adopted as his heir in 621, before later being returned to his original lineage.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗对李泰的宠爱超过了其他皇子，史载“宠冠诸王”，特许其长驻京畿、开文学馆，这种过度的宠爱是引发储位之争的重要原因。
description.en: Emperor Taizong's favor towards Li Tai surpassed that for his other sons. Historical records state he was 'the most favored among all princes,' granted special permissions to reside in the capital and establish a literary salon. This excessive favor was a major cause of the succession struggle.

description.zh-cn: 李泰因父亲的宠爱而图谋太子之位，与时任太子李承干构成了直接的竞争关系，最终导致李承干因谋反被废。
description.en: Favored by his father, Li Tai coveted the position of crown prince, becoming a direct rival to the incumbent Crown Prince Li Chengqian, which ultimately led to Li Chengqian's deposition for treason.

description.zh-cn: 643年，太子李承干因失宠且忌惮魏王李泰，与侯君集等人共谋刺杀唐太宗，事败被废。
description.en: In 643, Crown Prince Li Chengqian, having fallen out of favor and fearing Prince of Wei Li Tai, conspired with Hou Junji and others to assassinate Emperor Taizong. The plot failed, and he was deposed.

description.zh-cn: 侯君集与太子李承干共谋政变。
description.en: Hou Junji conspired with Crown Prince Li Chengqian to stage a coup.

description.zh-cn: 在李承干谋反事败后，唐太宗将其废为庶人。
description.en: After Li Chengqian's rebellion failed, Emperor Taizong deposed him and reduced him to the status of a commoner.

description.zh-cn: 在太子李承干被废后，褚遂良向唐太宗进谏，指出过分宠爱李泰是导致李承干之祸的根源，反对立李泰为新太子。
description.en: After Crown Prince Li Chengqian was deposed, Chu Suiliang advised Emperor Taizong that excessive favor towards Li Tai was the root cause of Li Chengqian's downfall and argued against appointing Li Tai as the new crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 在储位之争中，长孙无忌支持立晋王李治为太子。
description.en: During the succession struggle, Zhangsun Wuji supported the appointment of Prince Jin, Li Zhi, as the crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 在储位之争期间，李泰以汉王李元昌因谋反被杀之事来恫吓与李元昌交好的晋王李治。
description.en: During the succession struggle, Li Tai intimidated Prince Jin, Li Zhi, by referencing the case of Prince of Han, Li Yuanchang, who was executed for treason and had been on good terms with Li Zhi.

description.zh-cn: 唐太宗最终决定不立李泰为太子，并将其降封为东莱郡王，迁往均州。
description.en: Emperor Taizong ultimately decided not to make Li Tai the crown prince, demoting him to Prince of Donglai Commandery and exiling him to Junzhou.

description.zh-cn: 在废黜李承干和排除李泰后，唐太宗最终决定立晋王李治为皇太子。
description.en: After deposing Li Chengqian and excluding Li Tai, Emperor Taizong decided to establish Prince Jin, Li Zhi, as the crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 李治（唐高宗）继位后，在车服饮食方面对李泰予以优待，并允许他开府置僚属。
description.en: After ascending the throne, Li Zhi (Emperor Gaozong) treated Li Tai favorably in terms of clothing, food, and drink, and allowed him to establish his own princely court.

description.zh-cn: 李泰奏请并主编了地理著作《括地志》。
description.en: Li Tai requested permission to and served as the chief editor for the geographical work 'Kuodi Zhi'.

description.zh-cn: 贞观十五年，李泰为给亡母长孙皇后求冥福，在龙门山宾阳洞完成造像后镌刻了发愿文《伊阙佛龛碑》。
description.en: In the 15th year of Zhenguan (641), to pray for the soul of his deceased mother Empress Zhangsun, Li Tai commissioned the carving of the votive inscription 'Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche' after completing Buddhist statues in the Binyang Cave at Longmen.

description.zh-cn: 岑文本为《伊阙佛龛碑》撰写了碑文。
description.en: Cen Wenben composed the text for the 'Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche'.

description.zh-cn: 褚遂良为《伊阙佛龛碑》书写了碑文。
description.en: Chu Suiliang wrote the calligraphy for the 'Stele of the Yique Buddha Niche'.
